front.title: Non-photorealistic image processing: an Impressionist rendering
front.abstract: The paper proposes image processing methods for non-photorealistic rendering inspired by Impressionist and Pointillist painting techniques. The algorithm randomly selects pixels from the original image and substitutes them with colour spots through an iterative procedure. Both circular and anisotropic rectangular neighbourhoods are explored, along with threshold-based methods, to achieve stylized rendering effects that emphasize selected features and suppress fine details.
